idle_messages: Zerbrus: Want to know what monsters are good for you at your level? Just ask me!
Zerbrus: Are you injured or poisoned? I can help you.
Zerbrus: The premium side of Rookgaard lies beyond.
Zerbrus: No monster shall go past me.

(idle).text:
Zerbrus: Want to know what monsters are good for you at your level? Just ask me!
Zerbrus: Are you injured or poisoned? I can help you.
Zerbrus: The premium side of Rookgaard lies beyond.
Zerbrus: No monster shall go past me.
Zerbrus: For Rookgaard! For Tibia!

academy.text: Zerbrus: It's north of the temple.

al dee.text: Zerbrus: There's something about this guy I don't like.

amber.text: Zerbrus: She's very attractive. Too bad my duty leaves me no time to date her.

bank.text: Zerbrus: Before you fight monsters, deposit your money there. If you die, you won't lose it if it's save in the bank.

banor.text: Zerbrus: The heavenly warrior! Read books to learn about him.

book.text: Zerbrus: There are many books in the academy. Theory can be just as important as practice.

bear.text: Zerbrus: There is a bear cave close to this bridge. Be careful, though, they hit hard!

billy.text: Zerbrus: He's a farmer. A little more friendly than his cousin Willie, he also buys and sells food.

bug.text: Zerbrus: They are a little tougher than they look like, but they're still good beginner monsters.

cipfried.text: Zerbrus: He guards the temple and can heal you if you are badly injured or poisoned, just like me.

citizen.text: Zerbrus: I'm not a gossiper, but if you want to know something about a certain Rookgaardian, ask.

cockroach.text: Zerbrus: Nasty but easy to squish.

dallheim.text: Zerbrus: He does a fine job, protecting the north bridge. He's been on duty longer than me and knows the north side of Rookgaard well.

dixi.text: Zerbrus: She's Obi's granddaughter and deals with armors and shields. Her shop is south west of town, close to the temple.

dungeon.text: Zerbrus: I can mark you some dungeons on your map if you ask me about monsters suited for your level.

god.text: Zerbrus: I'm a follower of Banor.

heal.text: Zerbrus: You aren't looking really bad. Eat some food to regain strength.

help.text: Zerbrus: I have to stay here, sorry. But I can heal you if you are wounded. I have also valuable information about monsters.

hyacinth.text: Zerbrus: One of these reclusive druids.

info.text: Zerbrus: I'm an expert concerning the wildlife and monsters on this island.

job / protect.text: Zerbrus: I'm the guard of this bridge. I defend Rookgaard against the beasts of the wilderness and the dungeons, and even of the stinking sewers.

lee'delle.text: Zerbrus: Her shop is just north of the bridge. She really has good offers.

lily.text: Zerbrus: Gentle girl, but a little to esoteric for my taste. However, her potions might come in handy.

magic.text: Zerbrus: You will learn about magic soon enough.

minotaur.text: Zerbrus: Minotaurs are very strong. You will need a group of people or at least level 6 and good equipment to be able to kill them.

monster.text: Zerbrus: It looks like you have mastered the drill.

norma.text: Zerbrus: I don't approve of her opening a bar. Those drunken adventurers stumbling over the bridge at nighttime are not especially helpful in improving the situation.

obi.text: Zerbrus: He sells weapons. His shop is south west of town, close to the temple.

oracle.text: Zerbrus: You can find the oracle on the top floor of the academy, just above Seymour. Go there when you are level 8.

orc.text: Zerbrus: The orcs have a hideout under the troll cave, just descend deep. Still, be very careful!

rabbit.text: Zerbrus: They don't pose a threat. However, if you need food, they are good meat providers.

rat.text: Zerbrus: They're not that dangerous, but don't let yourself get cornered by many of them. They still can hurt.

rookgaard.text: Zerbrus: I'd give my life for protecting this village and its citizens.

rotworm.text: Zerbrus: Rotworms should not to be taken lightly. Luckily, there aren't any on this side. Talk to Dallheim if you need information about them.

santiago.text: Zerbrus: He dedicated his life to welcoming newcomers to this island.

seagull.text: Zerbrus: Just recently they've come to this island for nesting. They aren't dangerous.

sewer.text: Zerbrus: The sewers are crowded with rats. They make fine targets for young heroes.

seymour.text: Zerbrus: His job of teaching young heroes is important for the survival of all of us.

skeleton.text: Zerbrus: The skeletons on this island are usually fairly hidden. They are often found near graves and always underground. Beware of their evil life drain.

snake.text: Zerbrus: Snakes can poison you too, but their poison is usually not as dangerous as that of poison spiders. Just be careful and kill them fast.

spearman.text: Zerbrus: Spearmen are the toughest orcs on this island. Beware of their distance attacks!

spider.text: Zerbrus: There are two types of spiders on this island: normal spiders and poison spiders. As their name says, the latter ones can poison you which will cause a constant loss of your health. Beware of them!

temple.text: Zerbrus: A place of protection. Nothing can harm you there.

tibia.text: Zerbrus: In the world of Tibia, many challenges await the brave adventurer.

time.text: Zerbrus: My duty is eternal. Time is of no importance.

tom.text: Zerbrus: He's the local tanner. You could try selling fresh corpses or leather to him.

trade / armor / shield / potion / weapon.text: Zerbrus: Sorry, I don't trade. Ask the shop owners for a trade instead.

troll.text: Zerbrus: Once you have upgraded your equipment a little - maybe leather stuff - and got a better weapon, you should be able to kill trolls.

wasp.text: Zerbrus: Wasp hives exist only behind the north bridge, so ask Dallheim for information. I'm glad there are no wasps here. They always make me jump.

wilderness.text: Zerbrus: There are wolves, bears, snakes, deer, and spiders in the wilderness, past this bridge.

willie.text: Zerbrus: He's quite rude. Also, he buys and sells food.

wolf / wolv.text: Zerbrus: You need a stronger weapon than the starter club to kill wolves. Maybe a sabre or a short sword would do.

hint.text: Zerbrus: There is nothing more I can tell you. If you are still in need of some hints, I can repeat them for you.

triggers: trade / armor / shield / potion / weapon / sword / sabre / food / equipment / wares / sell / buy / offer / stuff

no / (any).text: The Oracle: COME BACK WHEN YOU ARE

bye / (vanish).text: The Oracle: COME BACK WHEN YOU ARE

academy.text: Lily: The academy is the big stone building in the town centre. If you're ready to leave Rookgaard, go there to see the oracle.

al dee.text: Lily: Best tool shop in town, if you ask me.

amber.text: Lily: I heard that she's recovering below the academy. She has been on an exciting expedition. I haven't talked to her yet, though.

antidote.text: Lily: Antidote potions will cure poisoning. They also have a lovely blueberry taste. You only need them when you get poisoned deep down in a dungeon, else just go to the temple for a free heal!

antidote potion.text: Lily: I can offer you homemade antidote potions and small health potions. Ask me for a trade if you like to see them.

armor.text: Lily: Armors? Best buy them at Dixi's little counter, just upstairs from Obi's shop. Or, if you have a premium account, go to Lee'Delle for better offers.

bank.text: Lily: It's wise to store most of your gold at the bank below the academy. It's safer that way.

billy.text: Lily: He's a farmer and sells food. Food will help you regain health when you are injured. Many monsters also carry food with them.

blueberry / berry / blueberries.text: Lily: Oh, do you have blueberries for sale? I need them for my antidote potion. I give you 1 gold for 5 of them, yes?

cipfried.text: Lily: Visiting Cipfried in the temple is a good idea if you are injured or poisoned. He can heal you.

citizen.text: Lily: If you tell me the name of a citizen, I'll tell you what I know about him or her.

cookie.text: Lily: Yum, cookies! If you have some for me, just ask me for a trade.

crunor.text: Lily: Crunor is the great lord of trees and the creator of all plants. Despite what some people believe, he didn't create the monsters, though.

dallheim.text: Lily: He is a great warrior. He can also tell you much about monsters and dungeons on this island.

deposit / flask / vial.text: Lily: I will pay you 5 gold for every empty vial and potion flask. Just ask me for a trade.

dixi.text: Lily: She's Obi's granddaughter and deals with armors and shields, just upstairs from Obi's shop.

druid.text: Lily: Being a druid is a wonderful profession. You control the forces of nature and can heal others.

dungeon.text: Lily: If you need information about the dungeons here, you should talk to one of the bridge guards. They will show you where to go.

equipment.text: Lily: You definitely need a good weapon, an armor and a shield. Also, you should never leave for a dungeon without rope, shovel and torch.

fight.text: Lily: If you want to fight monsters, you should get better equipment from the merchants. You should also talk to one of the bridge guards to find suitable monsters for you.

food.text: Lily: Oh, I'm sorry honey, I don't sell food. If you are hungry, visit one of the farmers Billy and Willie. I buy blueberries and cookies, though.

gold / money.text: Lily: Earn gold by fighting monsters and picking up what they carry. Sell it to merchants to make profit!

guard.text: Lily: Our bridge guards are Dallheim and Zerbrus. You can find Dallheim if you follow the path to the right, then turn north at the temple.

health.text: Lily: Health potions will heal you for about 75 hit points. It can't hurt to carry one with you, just in case.

help / information.text: Lily: How can I help you? If you like to buy something, just ask me for a trade. We can also chat about Tibia. Or, I could give you general hints about the game.

how are you.text: Lily: I'm in tune with myself and with nature. Thank you.

hyacinth.text: Lily: Hyacinth also sells small health potions. He lives outside the village, in a hidden place.

job.text: Lily: I'm a druid, bound to the spirit of nature. My potions will help you if you feel bad. I also buy blueberries and cookies. Just ask me for a trade.

king.text: Lily: I think Tibia would be a better place without authorities who lead others to war. Can't we just all live in peace?

lee'delle.text: Lily: If you are a premium adventurer, you should check out Lee'Delle's shop. She lives in the western part of town, just across the bridge.

loui.text: Lily: He used to help me gather blueberries. Then, one day, he suddenly stopped comming here. They say he went a little out of his mind.

main.text: Lily: The main continent is huge! The gods of Tibia created everything from great seas, deep jungles and large deserts.

merchant.text: Lily: To view the offers of a merchant, simply talk to him or her and ask for a trade. They will gladly show you their offers and also the things they buy from you.

monster.text: Lily: Sadly, our little village of Rookgaard is invaded by monsters. From the dungeons they creep to the surface and attack the city. We always need adventurers helping us to fight them.

name.text: Lily: My name is Lily, like the flower. It also stands for purity, just like my potions are!

norma.text: Lily: I don't know what to think about all this new bar. Rookgaard needs a little peace!

obi.text: Lily: He sells weapons. His shop is east of here.

offer / stuff / buy / wares.text: Lily: Just ask me for a trade to see my offers. If you want to sell blueberries, ask me about them separately.

oracle.text: Lily: You can find the oracle on the top floor of the academy, just above Seymour. Go there when you are level 8 to reach more areas of Tibia.

paulie.text: Lily: He takes care of the bank, keeping our money safe.

poisoning.text: Lily: Some creatures like snakes or poison spiders can poison you. That will diminish your health over a certain amount of time, so be careful when dealing with those creatures!

potion.text: Lily: I can offer you homemade antidote potions and small health potions. Ask me for a trade if you like to see them.

premium.text:
Lily: If you purchase premium time for your account, this opens up a lot of possibilities. ...  
Lily: For example, you will be able to travel off the mainland, ride a mount and benefit from offline training as well as having more outfits and magic spells to choose from.

rookgaard.text: Lily: Well, in this village and its surroundings you can train your skills until you are level 8. Then you should see the oracle and head to the main continent.

rope / shovel / torch.text: Lily: You best buy such equipment at Al Dee's store in the North of the village. Or, if you have a premium account, go to Lee'Delle for better offers.

santiago.text: Lily: We tried everything to fight that cockroach plague in his cellar, but natural anti-bug potions simply won't help. I guess those roaches need to be fought with stronger weapons.

sell.text: Lily: Just ask me for a trade to see what I buy from you. If you want to sell blueberries, ask me about them separately.

seymour.text: Lily: Seymour is a teacher running the academy. He has many important information about Tibia.

shield.text: Lily: Shields? Best buy them at Dixi's little counter, just upstairs from Obi's shop. Or, if you have a premium account, go to Lee'Delle for better offers.

shop.text: Lily: There are many shops around here which are owned by local citizens.

temple.text: Lily: The temple is just to the right. You can get a healing for free there if you are badly injured or poisoned.

tibia.text: Lily: Tibia is our beautiful world, created by the gods. Being a druid, I'm a worshipper of Crunor.

time.text: Lily: It's about 5:05 pm. But does it really matter? Don't rush yourself and enjoy all these little moments.

tom.text: Lily: He's the local tanner. You could try selling fresh corpses or leather to him.

trade.text: Lily: Of course, just browse through my offers. If you buy a potion, don't forget that there's a deposit of 5 gold on the empty flask.

train.text: Lily: To train your skills, simply help us fighting monsters.

weapon.text: Lily: If you are looking for weapons, you should visit Obi's shop east of here. Or, if you have a premium account, go to Lee'Delle for better offers.

willie.text: Lily: He's a farmer and sells food. Food will help you regain health when you are injured. Many monsters also carry food with them.

zerbrus.text: Lily: He is a great warrior. He can also tell you much about monsters and dungeons on this island.

zirella.text: Lily: That poor old woman. I wish I could help her.

hint.text: Lily: There is nothing more I can tell you. If you are still in need of some hints, I can repeat them for you.
